result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D. Gibney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Langlade County Case 12CF1 sentence defendant is now serving.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

DNA sample.  

After serving 5 years incarceration, defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.
To be paid out of defts prison funds at 25% - Joint and Several

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing on Jan. 22, 2016 before Judge Grau
US Bank $10,561.00 - joint & several w/Kevin Calhoun 15CF83

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:41am
State appears by ADA K.Puig and DA K.Heimerman; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Bachman.

State notes history of case; Parties state agreement as to sentence recommendation.
L.T. makes victim impact statement.
K.C. makes statement on behalf of defendant.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1>> 15 Years TOTAL: 10 years incarceration and 5 years ES, concurrent to Langlade County case 12CF1 sentence defendant is now serving w/credit for 357 days of time already served.
After serving 5 years incarceration, defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP; Prison wages to be paid toward CC and restitution.

CONDITIONS: N/C with US Bank or any of its employees; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; DNA sample and surcharge; CC; Restitution J&S of $10,561
Parties have agreed to release of vehicle and phone as stated in court to defendant's mother, subject to no appeal being filed as to those 2 items; COURT grants and items may be returned.

COURT remands defendant delivered back to WI State Prison system.

Adj: 9:56am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:26am
State appears by ADA K.Puig and DA K.Heimerman.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty John Bachman.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Robbery of Financial Institution/PTAC/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater enhancer.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Robbery of Financial Institution/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.

Parties note agreement that phone and car of defendant may be returned to him upon entry of plea.

State notes parties have agreement as to sentencing recommendation; however victim wishes to be present for sentencing
Sentencing scheduled for 2/25/16 at 9:00am -- DA  Heimerman states no PSI is being requested by either party.
Atty Bachman states defendant would like sentencing sooner than 2/25/16 -- COURT notes that 3 week trial starts Monday; Atty Bachman states he can be available this week - COURT directs parties to contact JA.

Adj: 11:40am

Final pre-trial at 01-20-2016 11:15 am.
Motion hearing at 02-05-2016 02:00 pm.
Jury Trial at 02-24-2016 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew D. Gibney
Current: c/o Prairie,   (Effective: 09-29-2015)
Prior: N774 Carley Road, Antigo, WI 54409

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:18am
State appears by DA Ken Heimerman and ADA K.Puig; Defendant does NOT appear - Atty John Bachman appears on his behalf by phone.

COURT notes this was status set for tracking information on PD appointing counsel.
Defendant does not appear as he was transported back to WI State Prison system as paperwork filed re: counsel appointment.
COURT directs parties set PTC in 3 weeks -- Atty Bachman has not yet received discovery, but Atty Kelz is sending to him this week.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:38am
State appears by DA Heimerman and ADA Puig; Defendant appears in person/pro se/in custody.
(STC re: counsel)

Defendant states he has not heard anything from PD's office.
DA Heimerman states he spoke with PDs office -- they were unaware that Atty Kelz was off this case and unaware that defendant needs new counsel appointed.
COURT directs defendant to take PD card and contact them.
COURT will also have JA make contact w/PD to follow up.
Defendant states he was unable to have phone calls/write letter to PD as he is being held here only by writ, and that does not allow him to make communication efforts.

COURT directs that when counsel is appointed, defendant may be returned back to prison on writ; Officer Blaschka notes he will make efforts to ensure defendant has access to speak to PDs office and/or speak with PD directly in jail today.
COURT directs matter be set on for STC in 10 days -- if counsel has been appointed by the next STC, then defendant may appear by phone from WI State Prison system; however, he must remain in MCJ for the time being until counsel is appointed.

Adj: 8:46am
and Order to Withdraw as Attorney-NOT signed

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:16pm
State appears by ADA K.Puig; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Karl Kelz
(Originally set as plea hearing)

Atty Kelz states Motion to Withdraw has been filed - Defendant states he is firing Atty Kelz.
COURT advises defendant that as Atty Kelz is appointed through PDs office, they will reappoint counsel, but choice for counsel is not unlimited - Defendant states understanding.
COURT finds defendant has fired Atty Kelz; Atty Kelz to advise PDs office of status.

To be set for STC with COURT in approx 2 weeks and that date to be given to PDs office.
Atty Kelz to submit alternate order.

Adj: 1:20pm
Status conference on July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 29, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case Called: 3:10pm  
State appears by ADA K.Puig and DA Heimerman; Deft appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Karl Kelz
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Discovery to be provided as soon as possible; To be set for PTC in 4 weeks
Bond:  Continued

Adj: 3:16pm
Preliminary Hearing on March 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena mailed to D.P.B. 2/2/15)

Pre-trial conference on February 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing on February 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): US Bank or co-defendant(s): D.C. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
